page.title: 08CUSTOMS
page.content: Club Day, an annual event in each village, is held in Warton on the first weekend in June and in Freckleton on the third weekend in June. Club Day is divided into two parts, the first being the procession through the streets of the village and the second the Fair and childrens' races. The procession is the oldest part of Club Day and was originally organised by the 'Friendly Societies' or 'Clubs' as the members knew them. These Clubs looked after the welfare of their members during hard times. To attract new members to the Clubs each would hold an annual procession through the streets to publicise the benefits of membership. After the walk refreshments were provided for members and their families. The visit of the Fair on these occasions also goes back many years.
